word:
MR No. 177 - Homes for the Unfortunate

     The school should have buildings to provide for such cases, and sufficient funds should be raised to put up suitable buildings on the grounds purchased for the school. If it is decided that this would not be wise, let the home be put up in another district. We must take hold of these things as soon as possible.--Ms 151, 1898, p. 22. ("Notes of Camp Meeting"--2. Typed Nov. 2, 1898.)
